content.question: A spaceship travels from a planet to a moon and passes through the three positions <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, shown above. Position <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is midway between the centers of the planet and the moon. The planet has a larger mass than the moon. At which location could the net gravitational force exerted on the spaceship be approximately zero?

choices.label: It cannot be determined without knowing the masses of the planet, the moon, and the spaceship, and the exact distance the spaceship is from the planet and the moon.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
